00062 #ifdef HAVE_EXT_PBLOCK /* Name changed to ldiskfs_ext_pblock for kernel 2.6.35 */
00063 #define ldiskfs_ext_pblock(ex) ext_pblock((ex))
00064 #endif
00065 
00066 /* for kernels 2.6.18 and later */
00067 #define fsfilt_ldiskfs_ext_insert_extent(handle, inode, path, newext, flag) \
00068                ldiskfs_ext_insert_extent(handle, inode, path, newext, flag)
00069 
00070 #define ldiskfs_mb_discard_inode_preallocations(inode) \
00071                  ldiskfs_discard_preallocations(inode)
00072 
00073 #ifndef LDISKFS_EXTENTS_FL
00074 #define LDISKFS_EXTENTS_FL                 0x00080000 /* Inode uses extents */
00075 #endif
00076 
00077 #ifndef EXT_ASSERT
00078 #define EXT_ASSERT(cond)  BUG_ON(!(cond))
00079 #endif
00080 
00081 #define EXT_GENERATION(inode)           (LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_ext_generation)
00082 #define ldiskfs_ext_base                   inode
00083 #define ldiskfs_ext_base2inode(inode)      (inode)
00084 #define EXT_DEPTH(inode)                ext_depth(inode)
00085 #define fsfilt_ldiskfs_ext_walk_space(inode, block, num, cb, cbdata) \
00086                         ldiskfs_ext_walk_space(inode, block, num, cb, cbdata);
00087 
00088 struct bpointers {
00089         unsigned long *blocks;
00090         unsigned long start;
00091         int num;
00092         int init_num;
00093         int create;
00094 };
00095 
00096 static long ldiskfs_ext_find_goal(struct inode *inode, struct ldiskfs_ext_path *path,
00097                                unsigned long block, int *aflags)
00098 {
00099         struct ldiskfs_inode_info *ei = LDISKFS_I(inode);
00100         unsigned long bg_start;
00101         unsigned long colour;
00102         int depth;
00103 
00104         if (path) {
00105                 struct ldiskfs_extent *ex;
00106                 depth = path->p_depth;
00107 
00108                 /* try to predict block placement */
00109                 if ((ex = path[depth].p_ext))
00110                         return ldiskfs_ext_pblock(ex) + (block - le32_to_cpu(ex->ee_block));
00111 
00112                 /* it looks index is empty
00113                  * try to find starting from index itself */
00114                 if (path[depth].p_bh)
00115                         return path[depth].p_bh->b_blocknr;
00116         }
00117 
00118         /* OK. use inode's group */
00119         bg_start = (ei->i_block_group * LDISKFS_BLOCKS_PER_GROUP(inode->i_sb)) +
00120                 le32_to_cpu(LDISKFS_SB(inode->i_sb)->s_es->s_first_data_block);
00121         colour = (current->pid % 16) *
00122                 (LDISKFS_BLOCKS_PER_GROUP(inode->i_sb) / 16);
00123         return bg_start + colour + block;
00124 }
00125 
00126 #define ll_unmap_underlying_metadata(sb, blocknr) \
00127         unmap_underlying_metadata((sb)->s_bdev, blocknr)
00128 
00129 #ifndef LDISKFS_MB_HINT_GROUP_ALLOC
00130 static unsigned long new_blocks(handle_t *handle, struct ldiskfs_ext_base *base,
00131                                 struct ldiskfs_ext_path *path, unsigned long block,
00132                                 unsigned long *count, int *err)
00133 {
00134         unsigned long pblock, goal;
00135         int aflags = 0;
00136         struct inode *inode = ldiskfs_ext_base2inode(base);
00137 
00138         goal = ldiskfs_ext_find_goal(inode, path, block, &aflags);
00139         aflags |= 2; /* block have been already reserved */
00140         pblock = ldiskfs_mb_new_blocks(handle, inode, goal, count, aflags, err);
00141         return pblock;
00142 
00143 }
00144 #else
00145 static unsigned long new_blocks(handle_t *handle, struct ldiskfs_ext_base *base,
00146                                 struct ldiskfs_ext_path *path, unsigned long block,
00147                                 unsigned long *count, int *err)
00148 {
00149         struct inode *inode = ldiskfs_ext_base2inode(base);
00150         struct ldiskfs_allocation_request ar;
00151         unsigned long pblock;
00152         int aflags;
00153 
00154         /* find neighbour allocated blocks */
00155         ar.lleft = block;
00156         *err = ldiskfs_ext_search_left(base, path, &ar.lleft, &ar.pleft);
00157         if (*err)
00158                 return 0;
00159         ar.lright = block;
00160         *err = ldiskfs_ext_search_right(base, path, &ar.lright, &ar.pright);
00161         if (*err)
00162                 return 0;
00163 
00164         /* allocate new block */
00165         ar.goal = ldiskfs_ext_find_goal(inode, path, block, &aflags);
00166         ar.inode = inode;
00167         ar.logical = block;
00168         ar.len = *count;
00169         ar.flags = LDISKFS_MB_HINT_DATA;
00170         pblock = ldiskfs_mb_new_blocks(handle, &ar, err);
00171         *count = ar.len;
00172         return pblock;
00173 }
00174 #endif
00175 
00176 static int ldiskfs_ext_new_extent_cb(struct ldiskfs_ext_base *base,
00177                                   struct ldiskfs_ext_path *path,
00178                                   struct ldiskfs_ext_cache *cex,
00179 #ifdef HAVE_EXT_PREPARE_CB_EXTENT
00180                                    struct ldiskfs_extent *ex,
00181 #endif
00182                                   void *cbdata)
00183 {
00184         struct bpointers *bp = cbdata;
00185         struct inode *inode = ldiskfs_ext_base2inode(base);
00186         struct ldiskfs_extent nex;
00187         unsigned long pblock;
00188         unsigned long tgen;
00189         int err, i;
00190         unsigned long count;
00191         handle_t *handle;
00192 
00193 #ifdef LDISKFS_EXT_CACHE_EXTENT
00194         if (cex->ec_type == LDISKFS_EXT_CACHE_EXTENT)
00195 #else
00196         if ((cex->ec_len != 0) && (cex->ec_start != 0))
00197 #endif
00198                                                    {
00199                 err = EXT_CONTINUE;
00200                 goto map;
00201         }
00202 
00203         if (bp->create == 0) {
00204                 i = 0;
00205                 if (cex->ec_block < bp->start)
00206                         i = bp->start - cex->ec_block;
00207                 if (i >= cex->ec_len)
00208                         CERROR("nothing to do?! i = %d, e_num = %u\n",
00209                                         i, cex->ec_len);
00210                 for (; i < cex->ec_len && bp->num; i++) {
00211                         *(bp->blocks) = 0;
00212                         bp->blocks++;
00213                         bp->num--;
00214                         bp->start++;
00215                 }
00216 
00217                 return EXT_CONTINUE;
00218         }
00219 
00220         tgen = EXT_GENERATION(base);
00221         count = ldiskfs_ext_calc_credits_for_insert(base, path);
00222 
00223         handle = ldiskfs_journal_start(inode, count+LDISKFS_ALLOC_NEEDED+1);
00224         if (IS_ERR(handle)) {
00225                 return PTR_ERR(handle);
00226         }
00227 
00228         if (tgen != EXT_GENERATION(base)) {
00229                 /* the tree has changed. so path can be invalid at moment */
00230                 ldiskfs_journal_stop(handle);
00231                 return EXT_REPEAT;
00232         }
00233 
00234         /* In 2.6.32 kernel, ldiskfs_ext_walk_space()'s callback func is not
00235          * protected by i_data_sem as whole. so we patch it to store
00236          * generation to path and now verify the tree hasn't changed */
00237         down_write((&LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_data_sem));
00238 
00239         /* validate extent, make sure the extent tree does not changed */
00240         if (EXT_GENERATION(base) != path[0].p_generation) {
00241                 /* cex is invalid, try again */
00242                 up_write(&LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_data_sem);
00243                 ldiskfs_journal_stop(handle);
00244                 return EXT_REPEAT;
00245         }
00246 
00247         count = cex->ec_len;
00248         pblock = new_blocks(handle, base, path, cex->ec_block, &count, &err);
00249         if (!pblock)
00250                 goto out;
00251         EXT_ASSERT(count <= cex->ec_len);
00252 
00253         /* insert new extent */
00254         nex.ee_block = cpu_to_le32(cex->ec_block);
00255         ldiskfs_ext_store_pblock(&nex, pblock);
00256         nex.ee_len = cpu_to_le16(count);
00257         err = fsfilt_ldiskfs_ext_insert_extent(handle, base, path, &nex, 0);
00258         if (err) {
00259                 /* free data blocks we just allocated */
00260                 /* not a good idea to call discard here directly,
00261                  * but otherwise we'd need to call it every free() */
00262 #ifdef LDISKFS_MB_HINT_GROUP_ALLOC
00263                 ldiskfs_mb_discard_inode_preallocations(inode);
00264 #endif
00265 #ifdef HAVE_EXT_FREE_BLOCK_WITH_BUFFER_HEAD /* Introduced in 2.6.32-rc7 */
00266                 ldiskfs_free_blocks(handle, inode, NULL, ldiskfs_ext_pblock(&nex),
00267                                  cpu_to_le16(nex.ee_len), 0);
00268 #else
00269                 ldiskfs_free_blocks(handle, inode, ldiskfs_ext_pblock(&nex),
00270                                  cpu_to_le16(nex.ee_len), 0);
00271 #endif
00272                 goto out;
00273         }
00274 
00275         /*
00276          * Putting len of the actual extent we just inserted,
00277          * we are asking ldiskfs_ext_walk_space() to continue
00278          * scaning after that block
00279          */
00280         cex->ec_len = le16_to_cpu(nex.ee_len);
00281         cex->ec_start = ldiskfs_ext_pblock(&nex);
00282         BUG_ON(le16_to_cpu(nex.ee_len) == 0);
00283         BUG_ON(le32_to_cpu(nex.ee_block) != cex->ec_block);
00284 
00285 out:
00286         up_write((&LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_data_sem));
00287         ldiskfs_journal_stop(handle);
00288 map:
00289         if (err >= 0) {
00290                 /* map blocks */
00291                 if (bp->num == 0) {
00292                         CERROR("hmm. why do we find this extent?\n");
00293                         CERROR("initial space: %lu:%u\n",
00294                                 bp->start, bp->init_num);
00295 #ifdef LDISKFS_EXT_CACHE_EXTENT
00296                         CERROR("current extent: %u/%u/%llu %d\n",
00297                                 cex->ec_block, cex->ec_len,
00298                                 (unsigned long long)cex->ec_start,
00299                                 cex->ec_type);
00300 #else
00301                         CERROR("current extent: %u/%u/%llu\n",
00302                                 cex->ec_block, cex->ec_len,
00303                                 (unsigned long long)cex->ec_start);
00304 #endif
00305                 }
00306                 i = 0;
00307                 if (cex->ec_block < bp->start)
00308                         i = bp->start - cex->ec_block;
00309                 if (i >= cex->ec_len)
00310                         CERROR("nothing to do?! i = %d, e_num = %u\n",
00311                                         i, cex->ec_len);
00312                 for (; i < cex->ec_len && bp->num; i++) {
00313                         *(bp->blocks) = cex->ec_start + i;
00314 #ifdef LDISKFS_EXT_CACHE_EXTENT
00315                         if (cex->ec_type != LDISKFS_EXT_CACHE_EXTENT)
00316 #else
00317                         if ((cex->ec_len == 0) || (cex->ec_start == 0))
00318 #endif
00319                                                                         {
00320                                 /* unmap any possible underlying metadata from
00321                                  * the block device mapping.  bug 6998. */
00322                                 ll_unmap_underlying_metadata(inode->i_sb,
00323                                                              *(bp->blocks));
00324                         }
00325                         bp->blocks++;
00326                         bp->num--;
00327                         bp->start++;
00328                 }
00329         }
00330         return err;
00331 }
00332 
00333 int fsfilt_map_nblocks(struct inode *inode, unsigned long block,
00334                        unsigned long num, unsigned long *blocks,
00335                        int create)
00336 {
00337         struct ldiskfs_ext_base *base = inode;
00338         struct bpointers bp;
00339         int err;
00340 
00341         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "blocks %lu-%lu requested for inode %u\n",
00342                block, block + num - 1, (unsigned) inode->i_ino);
00343 
00344         bp.blocks = blocks;
00345         bp.start = block;
00346         bp.init_num = bp.num = num;
00347         bp.create = create;
00348 
00349         err = fsfilt_ldiskfs_ext_walk_space(base, block, num,
00350                                          ldiskfs_ext_new_extent_cb, &bp);
00351         ldiskfs_ext_invalidate_cache(base);
00352 
00353         return err;
00354 }
00355 
00356 int fsfilt_ldiskfs_map_ext_inode_pages(struct inode *inode, struct page **page,
00357                                     int pages, unsigned long *blocks,
00358                                     int create)
00359 {
00360         int blocks_per_page = PAGE_CACHE_SIZE >> inode->i_blkbits;
00361         int rc = 0, i = 0;
00362         struct page *fp = NULL;
00363         int clen = 0;
00364 
00365         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "inode %lu: map %d pages from %lu\n",
00366                 inode->i_ino, pages, (*page)->index);
00367 
00368         /* pages are sorted already. so, we just have to find
00369          * contig. space and process them properly */
00370         while (i < pages) {
00371                 if (fp == NULL) {
00372                         /* start new extent */
00373                         fp = *page++;
00374                         clen = 1;
00375                         i++;
00376                         continue;
00377                 } else if (fp->index + clen == (*page)->index) {
00378                         /* continue the extent */
00379                         page++;
00380                         clen++;
00381                         i++;
00382                         continue;
00383                 }
00384 
00385                 /* process found extent */
00386                 rc = fsfilt_map_nblocks(inode, fp->index * blocks_per_page,
00387                                         clen * blocks_per_page, blocks,
00388                                         create);
00389                 if (rc)
00390                         GOTO(cleanup, rc);
00391 
00392                 /* look for next extent */
00393                 fp = NULL;
00394                 blocks += blocks_per_page * clen;
00395         }
00396 
00397         if (fp)
00398                 rc = fsfilt_map_nblocks(inode, fp->index * blocks_per_page,
00399                                         clen * blocks_per_page, blocks,
00400                                         create);
00401 cleanup:
00402         return rc;
00403 }
00404 
00405 int fsfilt_ldiskfs_map_bm_inode_pages(struct inode *inode, struct page **page,
00406                                    int pages, unsigned long *blocks,
00407                                    int create)
00408 {
00409         int blocks_per_page = PAGE_CACHE_SIZE >> inode->i_blkbits;
00410         unsigned long *b;
00411         int rc = 0, i;
00412 
00413         for (i = 0, b = blocks; i < pages; i++, page++) {
00414                 rc = ldiskfs_map_inode_page(inode, *page, b, create);
00415                 if (rc) {
00416                         CERROR("ino %lu, blk %lu create %d: rc %d\n",
00417                                inode->i_ino, *b, create, rc);
00418                         break;
00419                 }
00420 
00421                 b += blocks_per_page;
00422         }
00423         return rc;
00424 }
00425 
00426 int fsfilt_ldiskfs_map_inode_pages(struct inode *inode, struct page **page,
00427                                 int pages, unsigned long *blocks,
00428                                 int create, struct mutex *optional_mutex)
00429 {
00430         int rc;
00431 
00432         if (LDISKFS_I(inode)->i_flags & LDISKFS_EXTENTS_FL) {
00433                 rc = fsfilt_ldiskfs_map_ext_inode_pages(inode, page, pages,
00434                                                      blocks, create);
00435                 return rc;
00436         }
00437         if (optional_mutex != NULL)
00438                 mutex_lock(optional_mutex);
00439         rc = fsfilt_ldiskfs_map_bm_inode_pages(inode, page, pages, blocks, create);
00440         if (optional_mutex != NULL)
00441                 mutex_unlock(optional_mutex);
00442 
00443         return rc;
00444 }
00445 
00446 static struct fsfilt_operations fsfilt_ldiskfs_ops = {
00447         .fs_type                = "ldiskfs",
00448         .fs_owner               = THIS_MODULE,
00449         .fs_map_inode_pages     = fsfilt_ldiskfs_map_inode_pages,
00450 };
00451 
00452 static int __init fsfilt_ldiskfs_init(void)
00453 {
00454         return fsfilt_register_ops(&fsfilt_ldiskfs_ops);
00455 }
00456 
00457 static void __exit fsfilt_ldiskfs_exit(void)
00458 {
00459         fsfilt_unregister_ops(&fsfilt_ldiskfs_ops);
00460 }
00461 
00462 module_init(fsfilt_ldiskfs_init);
00463 module_exit(fsfilt_ldiskfs_exit);
